docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This system provides a backend for managing tickets and comments. It allows users to create, update, and retrieve tickets, as well as create comments associated with tickets.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text: The system consists of two main domains: Ticket and Comment. The Ticket domain handles ticket creation, retrieval, and status updates, while the Comment domain handles comment creation. The system uses a RESTful API with JSON data format.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Java runtime environment
  • HTTP client or API testing tool
  • JSON parsing library (if necessary)

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• Clone the repository containing the system code
  • Build the project using the provided build script
  • Start the server using the provided run script

docs.title: How To Run
docs.text:
• Use a HTTP client or API testing tool to send requests to the server
  • Send a GET request to /tickets to retrieve all tickets
  • Send a POST request to /tickets with a JSON body containing title and description to create a new ticket
  • Send a PUT request to /tickets/{id}/status with a query parameter status to update a ticket's status
  • Send a POST request to /comments with a JSON body containing message and ticket to create a new comment

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text:
• Create a new ticket: POST /tickets with a JSON body containing title and description
  • Get all tickets: GET /tickets
  • Update a ticket's status: PUT /tickets/{id}/status with a query parameter status
  • Create a new comment: POST /comments with a JSON body containing message and ticket

docs.title: Business Logic
docs.text: • Create a new comment and associate it with a ticket

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text: • Create a new comment: POST /comments with JSON body {"message": "Example comment", "ticket": {"id": 1}}

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: A system for managing tickets with different statuses

docs.title: API Endpoints
docs.text:
• GET /tickets — Get all tickets
  • POST /tickets — Create a new ticket
  • PUT /tickets/{id}/status — Update the status of a ticket

docs.title: Entities
docs.text:
• Ticket: id, title, description, status
  • Comment: id, text, ticketId

docs.title: Business Logic
docs.text:
• A ticket can be created with a title, description, and initial status
  • A ticket's status can be updated
  • All tickets can be retrieved

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text:
• Create a new ticket: POST /tickets with a JSON body containing title and description
  • Get all tickets: GET /tickets
  • Update a ticket's status: PUT /tickets/{id}/status with a query parameter status
